page.title: 03CONDERTON
page.content: Not very many years ago most of the inhabitants of{Conderton}were employed on the land, either in agriculture or market gardening. Mechanisation has now reduced that number to just 6 families, with the remainder commuting to the nearby towns, or enjoying their retirement. In the village there is a family run garage, a public house and a light engineering company, together with a professional model engineer who, among his many models, has produced a fully working fairground organ. The engineering company produces a variety of small springs for the electronics and automotive industries and springs from this factory are used in the Concord aeroplane thus illustrating how a village community can adapt to the modern world and it's changing demands.
